bibl.title: Leiffman v. Stein. Memo from Petitioner Attorney
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

org.orgName: United States District Court of Washington Territory, Second Judicial District

div1.p: from the State of Texas authorizing such arrest and imprisonment

3d. That the illegality of said restraint and imprisonment consists in this that the Defendant RP Stein, as such Sheriff or otherwise, has no such papers, documents or process whatever and that said Jackson has not produced or exhibited any such papers, documents or authority to complaint or to the Defendant Stein to complement has been Confined in said Jail for more than sixteen days

Wherefore complement prays that a writ Habeas Corpus issue herein, directs to said Defendant RP Stein Commanding him for the with to bring and have complainant before his Honor the said S.C. Wingard Judge of said Court as aforesaid at his Chambers in Collax the Coty of Walla Walla in said Judicial District, that the cause of his said restraint maybe engine of into and that he may be dealt with according to law
WA George Attorney for Pet Complainant
